meanings.definition: A medieval weapon consisting of an axe blade mounted on a long shaft.
meanings.sent1: In the museum, you can see a poleaxe used by knights long ago.
meanings.sent2: The warrior swung the poleaxe with great force in battle.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy knight accidentally dropped his poleaxe during the jousting match.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a poleaxe, cutting through his defenses effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight gleamed off the sharp blade of the poleaxe, making it look even more menacing.

meanings.definition: To strike or kill with a poleaxe.
meanings.sent1: The executioner poleaxed the condemned criminal swiftly.
meanings.sent2: He poleaxes the enemy soldiers in the heat of battle.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly threatened to poleaxe her brother if he didn't stop teasing her.
meanings.sent4: The shocking news poleaxed him, leaving him speechless.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected betrayal felt like a poleaxe to his heart, shattering his trust completely.
